main_definition: referring to or concerning each of two (or more) things in turn, especially when those things are being compared or discussed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to the individual subjects mentioned previously. For example, 'Each student submitted their respective project.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'The teacher reviewed each student's respective essay for the final grade assignment.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to the particular qualities or attributes of different entities. For example, 'In discussing the two books, we can now look at their respective authors and themes separately.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Their respective strengths lie in storytelling; however, Book A's author excels more than Book B's.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Concerning the specific sides or aspects of two (or more) related subjects. For example, 'The committee members reviewed their respective departments before meeting again.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Each department head gave a report on their respective areas during the company-wide meeting.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to particular persons or things that were previously mentioned. For example, 'The two candidates shared their respective experiences in front of the audience.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'During the debate, each candidate spoke about his/her respective background and qualifications for office.'
